description: Execute this PowerShell on Windows to list Desktop files
command: powershell -Command "$d = if(Test-Path $env:USERPROFILE\OneDrive\Desktop){$env:USERPROFILE+'\OneDrive\Desktop'}else{[Environment]::GetFolderPath('Desktop')}; Get-ChildItem $d | Select Name,Length,LastWriteTime | ConvertTo-Json | Out-File $env:USERPROFILE\.local\share\second-brain\desktop-files.json -Encoding UTF8"
